_header: Saint Swithin the confessor was here of England
Subjects: saints’ lives; Swithin, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Swithin in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEyn Swiþin þe confessour was of engelondeBi side
                    wynchestre he was ibore as ic vnderstonde…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…Nou seynt swiþin þat our biscop was her in
                    engelondeBringe ous to þe Ioie of heuene þoru our lordes
                    sonde

Bod779.First Lines:
Seint swiþþin þe comfessour was I bore in
                    ingelondeby syde þe toun of Winchestre also ich
                    ondirstonde…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…vor he leet þe stronge brigge wit oute þe toun
                    arere& ford þerto lym & ston & workmen þat þer
                    were
Bod779.Note: Whole text crossed out in MS.

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
SEint Swithþan þe confessour was her of EngelondeBi syde
                    Winchestre he was i bore as ich vndurstonde…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Seint Swiþþhan þat vre Bisschop was here in
                    EngelondeBring vs to þe Ioye of heuene þorwh vr lordes sonde
                    Amen
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
SEint Swithin þe confessour was here in EngelondBiside
                    Winchestre he was bore as I vnderstond…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…Now seint Swithin þat was bisshop here in
                    engelondeBringe vs to þe Ioye of heuene þorw oure lordes
                    sonde
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

CamCCC145.First Lines:
Sein swiþþin þe confessour was her of
                    engelondeBiside winchestre he was i bore as ich vnder
                    stonde…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…Nou sein switthin þat oure bissop was here in
                    engelondeBring us to þe ioie of heuene þoru oure louerdes
                    sonde
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 1.274-9.

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
…Ak þat word now habbeþ fforȝute þis heye men
                    echonSeint Swythin his Bisschopriche to alle goednesse
                    drow…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Now Seint Swythun þat oure Bisschop were her in
                    EngelondeHelp vs bringe to þe ioye of heuene þorw oure lordes
                    sonde
CamMagPep2344.Note: Begins imperfectly due to loss of folio(s).

CamTCC605.First Lines:
SEint swyþyn þe confessoure was here of englondeby sydes
                    wynchestre boren as ic vnderstonde…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…Now seint swyþyn þat byschop was here in englondTo
                    bringe ous to þe Ioie of heuene þorw oure lordes sonde

BLAdd10301.First Lines:
SEyn swiþþin þe confessor was her of engelondeBy
                    syde Wynchestre he was y bore as y vnder stonde…
BLAdd10301.Last Lines:
…Nou Sein Swithim þat oure bissop was here in
                    engelondeBring vs to þe Ioye of heuene þoru oure lordes
                    londe
BLAdd10301.Attributed Title:
De sancto switthino (f. 119, by scribe in margin beside first line);

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
Seynt Swithan þe Confessour was here in EngelondBeside
                    Wynchester he was bore as I vnderstonde…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…Seint Swithan þat bisshop was her in EngelondBryng vs to
                    þe ioie of heuene thorgh our lordis sonde. Amen.
